page.title: 03"Farming in Metheringham"
page.content: The village of Metheringham is surrounded by farm land, 8,000 acres of which belongs to Nocton Farms,which is owned by an insurance consortium. Nocton Farm produces cereals,peas, poatoes and Oil seed Rape.They also have some sheep.The Oil seed Rape is used for cooking oil and Margarine. In Blankney there are roughly 1,000 sheep, they roam around Metheringham Golf Course and are looked after by one shepherd and 3 dogs,there is also a pack of hounds in Blankney and the huntsman is Tony Wing. Robinsons, which is a local farm has a first class stud of shire horses.They often win prizes at the Lincolnshire Show.
